DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , randomise study compare endothelial dysfunction BMS v SES , implant patient multiple de novo coronary artery lesion undergo elective PCI . The primary end point evaluation endothelial dysfunction 6 month follow-up measure change vessel diameter 5 point stent peri-stent site infusion acetylcholine .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Endothelial Dysfunction ( BMS v SES ) Same Patient With Multiple Coronary Artery Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , randomise study compare endothelial dysfunction BMS v SES , implant patient multiple de novo coronary artery lesion undergo elective PCI . From february 2009 may 2009 aim enroll 20 patient least two de novo significant angiographic stenosis different coronary segment similar diameter length . The primary end point evaluation endothelial dysfunction 6 month follow-up measure change vessel diameter 5 point stent peri-stent site infusion acetylcholine .
DOC.criteria: stable angina pectoris least two significant angiographic stenosis different native coronary vessel vessel two different ramification similar diameter nonsurgical patient acute coronary syndrome myocardial infarction within 3 month event clinical angiographic coronary vasospasm coronary angiographic finding fresh thrombus initial angiography ( fill defect proximal involve stenosis ) coronary anatomy unsuitable intracoronary acetylcholine testing ( left main coronary artery disease > 30 % , surgical three vessel disease anatomical consideration make unsafe perform intracoronary study ) progression lesion development de novo lesion nontarget lesion vessel followup angiography patient vessel diameter < 2,50 mm length lesion < 10 > 30 mm . patient vessel diameter difference ( SES v BMS ) > 0,5mm length difference stenosis > 50 % lesion treat balloon injury < 10 mm > 50 mm length severe leave ventricular ( LV ) systolic dysfunction bifurcation/ostial presence unhealed dissection identify intravascular ultrasound ( IVUS ) perform end study . angiographic restenosis followup angiography patient severe risk factor endothelial dysfunction : severe renal failure , life expectancy le 1 year , uncontrolled diabetes , uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic blood pressure > 180mmHg ) , currently smoke , uncontrolled hypercholesterolemia ( total cholesterol > 240mg/dl ) contraindication/nontolerance use aspirin , heparin and/or clopidogrel lack consent participate
